item.title: 巴勒斯坦总理称将在特朗普的帮助下重建加沙
item.description: 巴勒斯坦权力机构总理穆罕默德-穆斯塔法（Mohammad Mustafa）说，他的政府计划在美国和沙特阿拉伯的帮助下重建加沙。【原文：Palestinian Authority Prime Minister Mohammad Mustafa said his government plans to rebuild Gaza with help from the US and Saudi Arabia, a process he said would reshape the Middle East and require the removal of Hamas from power and Israel from the ground.】

item.title: 随着日本央行加息，到 2028 年日本偿债成本将跃升 25
item.description: 由于央行逐步提高利率的行动导致融资成本上升，日本政府预计未来四年的年度偿债成本将上升至近 2300 亿美元。【原文：The Japanese government expects its annual debt-servicing costs to rise to almost $230 billion over the next four years as the central bank’s campaign to gradually raise interest rates drives up financing costs.】

item.title: 日本央行行长绯野发表讲话前日元兑美元走强
item.description: 由于交易商对日本央行副行长绯野良造周四讲话中可能出现的鹰派导向进行了定价，日元涨幅扩大，日本政府债券收益率上升。【原文：The yen extended gains and Japanese government bond yields rose as traders priced a potentially hawkish steer from Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Ryozo Himino’s speech on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储会议后比特币巩固涨势，鲍威尔发表评论
item.description: 在美联储作出利率决定以及主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发表简短评论谈及加密货币监管问题后，比特币出现了一周多以来的最大涨幅。【原文：Bitcoin held its biggest jump in more than a week following the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate decision and comments from Chair Jerome Powell that touched briefly upon crypto regulation.】

item.title: 菲律宾 2024 年经济增长令人失望，风险丛生
item.description: 菲律宾第四季度的经济增长速度低于预期，导致 2024 年的经济增长低于政府的目标。【原文：The Philippine economy grew slower than expected in the fourth quarter, dragging growth in 2024 below the government’s target in a year disrupted by storms and flooding.】

item.title: 私募基金为何盯上了我们的退休储蓄？
item.description: 对于澳大利亚的高管们来说，这本该是一个漫长的暑假。然而，对于澳大利亚最大的财富和养老金提供商之一 Insignia Financial 的 C-suite 来说，这个假期却被海外公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）和 CC Capital Partners 纷至沓来的收购要约打断了。主持人丽贝卡-琼斯（Rebecca Jones）和彭博财经记者哈里-布鲁姆普顿（Harry Brumpton）对这场竞购战进行了分析，它揭示了澳大利亚财富管理公司在全球舞台上日益增长的重要性，以及澳大利亚财富管理公司的未来发展方向。【原文：It was supposed to be a long summer break for Aussie executives. Instead, for the C-suite of one of Australia’s biggest wealth and superannuation providers, Insignia Financial, the holiday period was interrupted by a flurry of takeover offers from overseas players Bain Capital and CC Capital Partners. Host Rebecca Jones and Bloomberg finance reporter Harry Brumpton take a look at this bidding war, what it reveals about the growing importance of Australian wealth firms on the global stage, and th】

item.title: 软银洽谈向 OpenAI 投资 250 亿美元
item.description: 软银集团公司（SoftBank Group Corp. ）正在讨论向 OpenAI 投资高达 250 亿美元，此举有可能使其成为这家人工智能初创公司最大的支持者。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. is in discussions to invest as much as $25 billion in OpenAI, in a move that would potentially make it the AI startup’s biggest backer.】

item.title: 卢比之痛开始显现，印度顶级航空公司遭受重创
item.description: 经过两年的平静之后，卢比的突然下滑开始对印度企业的盈利造成压力，引发一些公司急于对冲货币风险。【原文：After two years of calm, the rupee’s sudden slide is starting to strain Indian corporate earnings, sparking a rush among some companies to hedge their currency exposures.】

item.title: 微软看好 DeepSeek 人工智能，并将其提供给客户
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp.微软公司首席执行官萨提亚-纳德拉（Satya Nadella）对 DeepSeek 说了几句好话。【原文：Microsoft Corp. Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella had some kind words for DeepSeek, the Chinese artificial intelligence startup that roiled his company’s shares earlier this week.】

item.title: 鲍威尔宣布美联储暂停宽松周期后，黄金维持跌势
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示官员们不会急于降低美国利率，并补充说央行正在暂停宽松政策以观察通胀方面的进一步进展之后，黄金保持了小幅下跌。【原文：Gold held a slight decline after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said officials won’t rush to lower US interest rates, adding that the central bank is pausing easing to see further progress on inflation.】

item.title: 日本央行将通过量化宽松措施削减资产负债表上近 5000 亿美元的余额
item.description: 上周，日本央行在缩减其庞大的资产负债表方面迈出了重要的一步，而市场观察人士则在关注该央行 18 年来最大的一次加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan made a significant step toward shrinking its massive balance sheet last week, while market watchers were fixated on the biggest interest rate increase from the central bank in 18 years.】

item.title: 鲍威尔发出信号：随着特朗普经济政策的成形，美联储将按兵不动
item.description: 这不是跳过，而是暂停，也许是延长的暂停。【原文：It’s not a skip, it’s a pause — and maybe an extended one.】

item.title: 英国家庭水费将从四月起创纪录上涨
item.description: 从 4 月份开始，英国的平均水费将上涨 26%，这是有史以来涨幅最大的一次，因为家庭和企业仍然感受到生活成本危机的影响。【原文：Average UK water bills are set to rise 26% from April, the biggest ever increase for households and business still feeling the sting of a cost-of-living crisis.】

item.title: 莫迪寻求刺激需求，减免所得税成为焦点：预算指南
item.description: 在亚洲第三大经济体增长放缓之际，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的政府可能会在即将公布的预算中重点关注促进消费的措施，同时坚持缩小财政赤字的路线图。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government will likely focus on steps to boost consumption in India’s upcoming budget, while sticking to the roadmap of narrowing the fiscal deficit at a time when growth is slowing in Asia’s third-largest economy.】

item.title: 美国贸易政策令交易商无所适从，石油走高
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）选中的商务部长表示，加拿大和墨西哥可能可以避免征税，投资者在等待美国政府的贸易政策计划明朗化的同时，石油价格走高。【原文：Oil edged higher as investors waited for clarity on the US administration’s plans for trade policy, with Donald Trump’s pick for commerce secretary saying Canada and Mexico may be able to avoid levies.】

item.title: 麦克尔姆表示，加拿大央行可以缓解关税带来的痛苦，但无法弥补损失
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）表示，央行无法弥补与美国的贸易战所造成的经济损失，但他会尽最大努力减轻贸易战带来的痛苦。【原文：Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem says the central bank can’t repair the economic damage of a trade war with the US — but he’ll do his best to make it less painful.】

item.title: 债券交易商押注诺沃亚将赢得投票，厄瓜多尔摆脱困境
item.description: 随着交易商加大对市场友好型总统丹尼尔-诺沃亚（Daniel Noboa）赢得连任的押注，厄瓜多尔债券两年多来首次走出困境。【原文：Ecuador’s bonds have emerged from distress territory for the first time in more than two years as traders ramp up bets market-friendly President Daniel Noboa will win a second term.】

item.title: 咖啡涨幅达 94% 终于触及需求的最后防线
item.description: 咖啡价格在过去一年中飙升了 90% 以上，其令人眼花缭乱的涨势已经损害了大多数主要市场的需求。现在，咖啡消费甚至开始在其最后阵地出现动摇。【原文：Coffee’s dizzying rally, which saw prices surge more than 90% in the past year, has already hurt demand in most major markets. Now, consumption is even starting to waver in the places where it was making a last stand.】

item.title: 去年德国支出比债务限额少 28 亿欧元
item.description: 由于未能通过预算和政府垮台阻碍了支出计划，德国去年没有完全用尽其严格的债务限额。【原文：Germany didn’t fully exhaust its strict debt limits last year after the failure to pass a budget and the collapse of the government hampered spending plans.】

item.title: 美达公司将支付 2500 万美元以结束特朗普就 1 月 6 日禁令提起的诉讼
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）声称，2021 年 1 月 6 日美国国会大厦发生骚乱后，他被禁止使用该公司的社交媒体网络是非法的审查制度，总统的一名律师表示，Meta Platforms Inc.【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to pay $25 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that his ban from the company’s social media networks after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, a lawyer for the president said.】

item.title: 智利国会为长期追求的养老金改革提供最后支持
item.description: 智利国会最终批准了一项将提高现有和未来退休人员养老金的改革方案，但总统加布里埃尔-博里奇（Gabriel Boric）在其政府做出重大让步后只获得了部分胜利。【原文：Chile’s Congress gave its final approval to a reform that will boost pensions for current and future retirees, handing President Gabriel Boric only a partial win following major concessions from his government.】

item.title: 拜朱的高管和业务合作伙伴被美国法院裁定藐视法庭
item.description: 印度一家陷入困境的科技公司 Byju's 的一名高管和该公司创始人的一名盟友因拒绝遵守美国法院的命令而被认定藐视法庭，现在面临每天 2.5 万美元的经济制裁。【原文：A top executive of troubled Indian tech firm Byju’s and an ally of the company’s founder were found in contempt of court and now face financial sanctions of $25,000 a day for refusing to comply with a US court order, a judge ruled Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储和美国科技公司财报公布后，亚洲市场开盘疲软：市场综述
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，官员们并不急于降息，美联储一如预期维持利率不变，亚洲股市周四有望追随美国股市走低。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to track their US peers lower on Thursday after the Federal Reserve held rates unchanged as expected, with Chair Jerome Powell saying officials were not in a hurry to lower rates.】

item.title: 沃达丰计划推出 Starlink 竞争产品以连接偏远地区

item.title: Meta 称本季度销售额将低于预期
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司预计本季度的销售额将低于预期，这使人们怀疑该公司能否迅速发展数字广告业务，以支持人工智能和其他未来产品的重大计划投资。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is projecting worse-than-expected sales in the current quarter, risking doubt that it can grow its digital advertising business quickly enough to support significant planned investments in artificial intelligence and other futuristic products.】

item.title: 巴西将关键利率上调 1 个百分点，并维持指导原则
item.description: 巴西央行在连续第二次会议上将其关键利率上调了整整一个百分点，新任行长承诺将采取必要行动抑制飙升的通胀预期。【原文：Brazil’s central bank lifted its key interest rate by a full percentage point for the second straight meeting as its new governor pledges to do what’s necessary to rein in soaring inflation expectations.】

item.title: 交易员在与美联储相关的债券期权赌注上牟利数百万美元
item.description: 一位债券交易员似乎中了头奖，他押注国债收益率将在周三美联储做出决定后攀升。【原文：A bond trader appears to have hit the jackpot on a one-day options bet that Treasury yields would climb Wednesday after the Federal Reserve’s decision, potentially raking in millions of dollars in profits.】
